quoteFirst: Whether we account for it by the extreme heat or not, it is nevertheless a fact that the sun lags along behind our clocks during this entire month; on the 1st, not reaching the meridian till 12:03:41 p. m.; on the 15th till 12:0
quoteLast: , and on the 30th till six minutes and nine seconds after noon. The time of the sunâ€™s rising on the 1st, 15th and 30th, is 4:33, 4:43 and 4:56 a. m.
title: The Chautauquan, Vol. 04, July 1884, No. 10
author: Chautauqua Literary and Scientific Circle; Chautauqua Institution; Flood, Theodore L., 1842- [Editor]
